tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_name VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(255),
    reading FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE anomalies (
    anomaly_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    anomaly_type VARCHAR(255),
    anomaly_description VARCHAR(255),
    detection_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_id) REFERENCES sensor_data(sensor_id)
);

CREATE TABLE sensors (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 sensor_name VARCHAR(50),
 sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
 location VARCHAR(50),
 timestamp TIMESTAMP,
 reading FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE anomalies (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 sensor_id INT,
 anomaly_type VARCHAR(50),
 detected_at TIMESTAMP,
 severity VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE anomalies_log (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 anomaly_id INT,
 log_description TEXT,
 logged_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE anomalies (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date TIMESTAMP,
    sensor_id INT,
    anomaly_type VARCHAR(50),
    severity INT
)

CREATE TABLE sensors (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_name VARCHAR(50),
    location VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE readings (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    reading_value FLOAT,
    date TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE anomalies_history (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    anomaly_id INT,
    date TIMESTAMP,
    remediation VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE anomalies_detection (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    anomaly_id INT,
    sensor_id INT,
    detection_method VARCHAR(50),
    detection_date TIMESTAMP
)
